meanings.definition: Sewing: a stitch made over the edge of fabric to prevent fraying
meanings.sent1: She used overcasting to secure the hem of her dress.
meanings.sent2: The tailor recommended using overcasting to finish the seams.
meanings.sent3: The overcasting on the dress was so neat, it looked like a professional job.
meanings.sent4: Her skillful overcasting was like a protective shield for the fabric.
meanings.sent5: The overcasting added a beautiful touch to the garment.

meanings.definition: Weather: the process of clouds forming over an area
meanings.sent1: The overcasting of clouds signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent2: The overcasting of the sky made the day feel gloomy.
meanings.sent3: The overcasting of clouds seemed like nature's way of painting the sky gray.
meanings.sent4: The overcasting of clouds was like a blanket covering the sun.
meanings.sent5: The overcasting of the sky created a mysterious atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Acting: to exaggerate or overemphasize a role or performance
meanings.sent1: She tends to overcasting her emotions in dramatic scenes.
meanings.sent2: The actor was criticized for overcasting his lines in the play.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to overcasting his role made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The actress's overcasting of her character brought a comedic element to the play.
meanings.sent5: The director advised the actors not to overcasting their expressions.
